host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
I'm from New York City. 
I'm Into music, sports, drinks, traveling, and meeting new friends

reviews.comments: good

My Stay at Esmond's Place was AMAZING!
Esmond was very helpful, Kind and easy to get a hold of!
I was Welcomed with a Basket filled with Champagne! :) What More could You ask for?!!
The Loft was immaculate and  Looked Just like the Pictures displayed but even better. The Furniture, (bed and Sofa) are extremely comfortable and give a warm feel to the loft! Esmond also has a beautiful Piano, That Brings  an awesome Creative vibe to his place. The Neighborhood is very peaceful and Serene and well kept. The Block almost feels like a suburb in the middle of the city. Getting anywhere in Manhattan from Esmond's place is quite Simple. There Are many Nice Restaurants In the Area, My Favorite would be a well known 24 hour spot, called "Cafeteria" less than 5 minutes Away. There's  also a Pharmacy and Grocery Store a block away from the Apartment! It's the Perfect place to Stay! I definitely would Stay there again!
Lovely apartment - clean, comfy and great location. Esmond was very friendly and helpful - an excellent host! The flowers and fizz on arrival was a really nice touch. Thanks!

A great stay in a great appartment, nice (identical to the photos), comfortable and well located! Thanks to Esmond for his warm welcome with champagne and his availability during our all stay in his place, very appreciated. I recommend!

This was my first time using AirBnB and my first time in NYC. Esmond was prompt in responding to my queries before booking and just as helpful in the lead up to my trip with arranging to meet at the apartment and handing over keys etc.

The apartment was exactly as described and in the photos. It has everything you need for a stay in the city and is the perfect size for a couple. Location is great for local bars and diners and it's only a short walk to the local subway.

Overall if you're looking for great communication, perfect apartment and a prime location this is your place. I would definitely visit again.
Esmond was a great host. My flight was late and he was there to help me get settled. The apartment was as clean and the location was great. I would stay there again!

The apartment is really nice and comfortable. Furthermore, it's warm and spacious and the location is great to walk to almost everywhere in Manhattan. 
Esmond was  always available to our questions. We didn't meet him in person, but he seems to be a really nice guy. 
A good choice with no doubt!

It was great staying at Esmond's place. He communicates well and made sure we had everything we needed. The apartment is really comfortable and the neighborhood is very convenient. Would stay there again.

Fantastic loft. My wife and I loved having a kitchen and a bedroom space whilst we stayed 16 nights at the apartment. Great spot to get the feel of New York. About a 7-10min walk to subway. Very clean and very comfortable. 

Great experience overall!!

A notre arrivée nous avons été accueilli par Esmond. Nous avons fait un rapide tour de l'appartement et nous avons ensuite pris possession de celui-ci. Nous avons adoré l'appartement d'Esmond. Il correspondait à la description. Il avait même pris la peine de fleurir l'appartement. Le quartier est calme et très sur. L'appartement est très bien situé : il est proche de Union Square, de Madison square Park, de l'empire State Building. Nous recommandons cette appartement.

Esmond was very welcoming and made sure I was well acquainted with the place before he left. He was always reachable if I had questions. The place is wonderful and in a very ideal location, I highly recommend this to solo or duo travelers.

Esmond was very communicative, key exchange was seamless, and the apartment itself was great, just like in the photos and description.  Short walk to the subway, several bars, restaurants, and parks.  Really positive experience overall, 5 star all 'round.

We booked Esmond's place for just over a week and couldn't have been happier with the stay! The apartment is unique in itself, and very very comfortable, spacious and clean. I had been trying to book this for a few months now (as we had other employees traveling to NY) and will certainly be in touch to book this again in the future.

Perfection! Esmond's place was our home away from home! It was beautifully furnished, spotless, very comfortable, quiet, private yet in the perfect spot close to everything!  The location was close to a market, bank, laundry, several neat restaurants, coffee and pastry shops!  We felt very safe and comfortable! We loved the multi level and especially the fact that you don't have to wait for elevator and just steps in the front door of the building!  We are already planning our next trip and will definitely be staying at Esmond's!   Thanks for a wonderful long weekend--- M  & J

Staying at Esmond's place was a great experience altogether. The apartment is very bright (a real pleasure in NY), tastefully furnished and clean and moreover featured everything we needed during our stay.
I loved staying at Esmond's! His apartment is amazing and he is a great host i will book again for sure!
Esmond is a great host! Communication was very easy and friendly. The apartment is cozy, very neat, spacious, and stylish! The block was quiet and beautiful. I totally recommend it!

Really good place.
Esmond was available all the Time for any question during our stay at the apartment.
The place is confortable, Clean and cosy !
Everything you need is around, super location close to everything by Walk ! 
I will return for sure

Thanks Esmond for having us at your apartment. We really appreciated your cheerful welcome, and having a cosy, stylish and clean space to call home for our holiday in New York. We found the location of the apartment very convenient - about 7 minutes walk to the 4,5,6 metro and same again to the L to get over to Brooklyn or to the west side. Your dining recommendations were fantastic - Eataly and Gramercy Tavern were particular highlights. Thank you again!

The neighborhood was beautiful, with ample parking and only a 10 minute walk from where I work in Union Park. The listing was exactly as it was described, and was extremely clean and well-maintained. I'd definitely be interested in staying here again for future business trips into New York :)

Esmond è un ottimo padrone di casa,educato,puntuale e disponibile. L'appartamento è spazioso,elegante e ben attrezzato. Appena entri trovi la cucina,ben attrezzata e con lavastoviglie. Proseguendo c'è il salottino con un pianoforte Yamaha mezza coda,televisore grande e due divanetti. Salendo al piano superiore c'è un grosso specchio utilissimo ,il bagno ben attrezzato( shampoo e balsamo,fon,asciugamani ), una piccola zona studio divisa dalla camera da letto con una libreria. Il letto è molto comodo. Difetti? Credo che in estate si muoia di caldo in camera da letto ed in bagno. C'è l'aria condizionata in casa ma non raffredda la camera da letto quindi tutto il piano superiore. L'unico modo è accendere il ventilatore che fa molto rumore e smuove solo l'aria calda. Per quanto riguarda la pulizia la casa speravo meglio.

It was my second time in the apartment and for sure will have the 3rd...4th...5th.

Great apartment, host, location. Thank you one more time!

Esmond was a great host, waiting up for us when our plane was late and was quick to respond if we needed anything. I had a lot of questions before staying here as it was the first airbnb I've done and Esmond was patient and very easygoing. The only negative feedback I will have to say is it did get quite hot in the bedroom loft. We were staying over the thick of summer and most nights the a/c didn't reach the loft so we had a few sleepless nights. Also it is on the ground floor so we had some privacy concerns but all in all we loved the apartment and felt safe in the area. Easy to get anywhere in NYC from here! Thanks Esmond, I'd definitely stay here again!

My boyfriend and I had an amazing Labor Day Holiday in New York. Esmond's place is gorgeous and listed as described- piano and all!  The location made it a perfect home base as Gramercy is easily accessible by the subway and the neighborhood felt really safe.  Esmond was a gracious host, especially when we asked to check in close to 1am in the morning. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Esmond's place again. Thank you, Esmond!

Esmonds place was amazing. We loved the loft style of the apartment, It was large, so clean and very nice decor. It has a piano in it! We met Esmond and he was very easy to communicate with, very nice and very helpful. We loved our stay and would stay again and recommend it to others. Thank you Esmond!

My first stay using Airbnb and the place was fantastic! Esmond was already waiting for me when I arrived and the exchange of keys was quick and easy. The place is in a lovely and quiet neighborhood with short walking distance to plenty of subway lines; nearly all of the major sights in Manhattan can be accessed by a single subway line if you plan properly. The place looks exactly as it shows in the photos as well. The bed was comfortable and living in a time zone 12 hours away, my jet lag was gone right away. My highest recommendation.

Esmond's place was awesome! I stayed here for a month while job hunting in New York. Close enough to the 456 and the NQR subway lines, close to Union Square, plenty of places to eat/order Seamless from around. Super well located. The apartment itself was very comfortable. I stayed in a number of Airbnbs for almost two months spanning Chelsea, East Village, Hell's Kitchen and this place, and it was definitely my favorite unit. 

Had no issues with the check in/check out, everything is pretty much straightforward, just the way I like it.
Absolutely loved the place. Central and well equipped. Would definitely stay again when visiting New York. Thanks, Esmond!

Will recommend this apt to my friends! Very cozy and close to everything. Although we didn't have a chance to meet Esmond, he well assisted us check in/out through text messages, and replied to our questions asap.

I rented this place for my parents stay while they visited me in New York. They loved the place, it was very spacious and comfortable. The neighborhood is great with several good restaurants nearby, and it's also very convenient to walk around the city. Esmond is a great host, and he was very responsive whenever we had any questions.

Esmond is very responsive and helpful. The apartment is well located and close to amenities. The building heat made the apartment very warm when we stayed there, though the weather was unseasonably warm. Thanks for having us.
Stedet er som på bildene, rent og pent. Leiligheten er i første etasje. Madrassen er på den fastere siden.

I've stayed in several NYC Airbnb's for work this year and this was by far the nicest and the QUIETEST.  Amazingly quiet street, walkable to the 6 and close to grocery stores etc.  Fully equipped kitchen which I loved.  We had a little plumbing issue at the beginning but Esmond took care of it within a couple of days.  Only bit of caution--even once the super turned the heat off during my second week, the bedroom upstairs was very toasty--even with the downstairs AC on!

Edmunds place is beautiful.  There is a firm mattress if you like firm. The bathroom is very clean and large. The floor-to-ceiling windows were wonderful.  I love natural lighting. I also loved the dimmed Chandelier at night that hangs above the living room.  The kitchen is large with a very large refrigerator for Manhattan. It really was a great stay and I'd recommend it to anybody wanting to stay in Manhattan at a convenient place that's close to everything.

Esmond was a lovely host, friendly and flexible with check in and check out times which we appreciated. The apartment is a good space for a couple, even with the grand piano it was spacious enough (especially as we had 4 suitcases!). During our stay there was a bit of a heat wave in New York and being a ground floor unit with a big beautiful window with just a sheer curtain, which let in so much light also made it very warm even with the air conditioning - this might have been a building issue as we found the hallway of the building to be extremely humid during the hotter days. In saying that it would be really cozy in the cooler months. The area was one we'd not explored previously - more on the quiet side (if that's even possible in New York) but very close to the Flatiron, Union Square and also East Village which are more lively. I'd highly recommend the burgers at Ampersand Bar which is walking distance from the apartment.

Esmond's place was incredibly beautiful. From the large windows to the grand piano, he delivered a wonderful apartment in the Gramercy Park neighborhood. The apartment was indeed wonderful with just a tiny dust and heating issue. My roommate has severe asthma and non severe sleep apnea. On our first night she didn't sleep. She couldn't breath as it was roughly 80-85 degrees upstairs. She ended up sitting in the kitchen all night as that was the least problematic place, for her, in the unit. After a couple nights of not sleeping for my roommate, we decided to purchase an air mattress so she could sleep downstairs and breath comfortably. When placing the air mattress we had to move the coffee table over an inch which revealed a massive amount of dust everywhere. It was probably one of the worst dust situations I had ever seen. This was especially surprising since I was just informed of the recent cleaning. However, all it took was a few boxes of wipes, which I purchased, and a broken vacuum, that we found in the home, to fix the issue. Unfortunately and unbeknownst to me, I had a roommate who was unaware of the contract I had signed with Esmond and  slipped on a few of Esmond's rules : such as having house guests one night and placing materials on the piano.  When Esmond brought it to my attention, he dealt with it effectively and with kindness. Along with the rules mentioned above, he also said that the air-mattress was not permitted, although I couldn't find that rule on the Airbnb website nor the sheet he left me.  That was cleaned up between Esmond and I and we were back on the road to a good stay. Until I experienced a small amount of despair when the building  informed me that, per Esmond's contract with the condominium, Airbnb's are not ever permitted in the building. I went to look for the sheet Esmond had left me, upon arrival, and it did state for me to tell anyone, if asked, that Esmond is my cousin. I would've rather Esmond messaged that to me prior to the stay, or listed it on the site, as it possibly would have changed my mind when deciding to stay at an Airbnb where I would have to, for lack of a better word, lie to someone. With that said, I apologized for his inconvenience as I, in retrospect, ideally should've communicated with my roommate the specific details and inquires set forth by Esmond prior to our stay. None the less, I am pleased with the stay I had with Esmond and the issues we experienced throughout the stay were simply a small line of communication errors.
I definitely recommend it
Esmond and the apartment are truly amazing.

Esmond was very accommodating - very responsive, check in/check out was so easy, our interactions were pleasant, he was friendly and helpful throughout my entire stay. I would highly recommend booking with Esmond - I will definitely book again for business trips in the future.
Esmond was such a great host! The home was beautiful, clean and located in a central part of Gramercy. Will rebook next time I'm in the city. Thanks again for such a wonderful stay!

Esmond was a responsive and friendly host, though check-in turned into a hassle to coordinate through his friend who was meant to let me in. The apartment is a stylish space that was well equipped. However, the other reviews were unfortunately accurate in that the loft area became unbearably hot. Since the apartment is facing the street and is on the first level, I could only keep the windows open when I was close by. Also be cautioned that AirBnbs are not allowed in Esmond's place, which became uncomfortable a few times since I had a longer stay (two weeks). 

I would consider staying here again since it's close to my work and provided a better solution were worked out to deal with the heat upstairs.
Such a wonderful 2 week stay! The apt is so stylish and spacious. Great amenities and incredible location. I’ll definitely be coming back!

It is pretty much as advertised. Very very stylish apartment. It was super clean. I liked the neighborhood, kind of quite but there are a also a ton of places near by and they are not too crowded.

The only terrible part of the apartment is the heat. The a/c is useless. It gets really really hot in bedroom and sometimes it is hard to sleep (and it was not even hot weather outside when I was staying there).
Beautiful apartment on a quiet street!
Great place, clean, central and feels spacious. Highly recommended.

Wonderful experience, good location, stylish loft, very kind.
주변에 다 있고 위치가 좋아요. 집도 깨끗하고 2층공간이 넓어서 머물기 좋은데 3주 있는 동안 바퀴벌레가 크기 별로 나왔네요..... 그것 말고는 다 좋았습니다.

This apartment is fantastic. My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 2 weeks over Christmas and it was perfect. Great location short walk to the Subway which is the only form of transport needed.Franks around the corner is a fantastic little Italian restaurant for great Italian food. There is a heap of variety of shops at your fingertips supermarkets, restaurants, laundry ect. There is a great kitchen also. We would 100% recommended staying here it was great for us. Thank you again Max.
Had a great stay at Max's place. The location is fantastic and the area has a lot to offer. The one thing to be aware of is the sleeping quarters (upstairs) tends to get VERY WARM.

name: Appartement dans quartier super!
summary: Joli appartement très bien équipé et très bien situé! Tout ce qu'il faut pour les séjours de longue durée. À 30 secondes à pied du populaire Marché Jean-Talon! À 4 minutes à pied du métro et près d'arrêts d'autobus de jour et de nuit. Très près de la Petite-Italie, de restaurants, de cafés, de bars. Quartier multiculturel où on trouve des commerces et des produits intéressants. Bref, appartement et quartier super pratiques où il y a tout ce dont on a besoin.
space: L'appartement est tout équipé : vaisselle, casseroles, drap, serviettes, machine à laver, lave-vaisselle, cafetière expresso, internet sans fil. Il y a une télévision, mais je n'ai pas le câble. L'appartement n'est pas neuf et c'est ce qui fait son charme! C'est un appartement typiquement Montréalais, il se trouve dans un immeuble datant des années 30. Il a de beaux planchers de bois franc, il est propre et confortable, notamment pour les longs séjours puisqu'il y a vraiment tout ce qu'il faut. Il est possible d'installer une personne ou deux de plus dans le salon puisqu'il y a un sofa lit. Par contre, tenez compte du fait que la chambre n'a pas de porte.
description: Joli appartement très bien équipé et très bien situé! Tout ce qu'il faut pour les séjours de longue durée. À 30 secondes à pied du populaire Marché Jean-Talon! À 4 minutes à pied du métro et près d'arrêts d'autobus de jour et de nuit. Très près de la Petite-Italie, de restaurants, de cafés, de bars. Quartier multiculturel où on trouve des commerces et des produits intéressants. Bref, appartement et quartier super pratiques où il y a tout ce dont on a besoin. L'appartement est tout équipé : vaisselle, casseroles, drap, serviettes, machine à laver, lave-vaisselle, cafetière expresso, internet sans fil. Il y a une télévision, mais je n'ai pas le câble. L'appartement n'est pas neuf et c'est ce qui fait son charme! C'est un appartement typiquement Montréalais, il se trouve dans un immeuble datant des années 30. Il a de beaux planchers de bois franc, il est propre et confortable, notamment pour les longs séjours puisqu'il y a vraiment tout ce qu'il faut. Il est possible d'installer une perso
neighborhood_overview: Le quartier dans lequel est situé l'appartement est un quartier multiethnique. On y trouve des marchés asiatiques, magrébins, latinos-américains et des restaurants du cuisine de différents pays. Au marché Jean-Talon, de l'autre côté de la rue, il y a des fromageries, des boucheries, des boulangeries, des poissonneries, des marchands de fruits et légumes, la société des alcools du Québec, des cafés, un pub, des restaurants. Super pratique!
transit: L'appartement est à 4 minutes à pied du métro Jean-Talon (ligne orange et bleue). Il y aussi de nombreuses lignes d'autobus, dont des bus de nuit.
access: Vous avez accès à tout l'appartement ainsi qu'aux deux balcons.
interaction: Je suis disponible en tout temps par message pour répondre à vos questions.
house_rules: Ne fumez pas dans l'appartement! Pas de musique forte s'il vous plaît! Pas de fêtes. Lisez les instructions de la machine à café et du lave-vaisselle avant de les utiliser. Merci!

reviews.comments: Catherine's home was clean, conveniently located, and well appointed. Being right across from the market and in Little Italy is a huge plus. We had a great stay!

Une expérience superbe chez Catherine! Les photos ne font pas justice, on à vraiment aimez notre séjour- elle à vraiment du style cette femme :)
J'ai hâte de retourner <3
The host canceled this reservation 52 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The place was perfect, we spent there 5 days and had the feeling to be home. Well equipped with all you can find to cook or to clean, the apartment is well located for exploring Montreal. Catherine is a great host, easily reachable. We did not meet her but she made things easy for us with clear instructions. Absolutely recommended.

The apartment was great (my partner exclaimed on our first day there that it was like the love child of Salvador Dali and Frida Kahlo) and being right across from the Jean Talon Market is a huge perk.  We were able to go shopping at the market and then cook rather than eating out for every meal.   Everything was clean and bright and colorful, and we had no problems finding the apartment or getting around the city- it's just two blocks from the metro station.   Catherine was very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay, it made me want to move to Montreal!

Le logement était comme décrit. L'emplacement près du marché Jean talon est vraiment un PLUS. Tout était propre et fonctionnel...
Joli appart. Aucun contact avec l'hôte mais une note descriptive des lieux était somme toute suffisante.

I didn't have a chance to meet Catherine but she gave me the proper instructions on how to get into the apartment with ease. I really enjoyed my stay and felt like I had plenty of space. The apartment was equipped will all the essential needs for a week long stay. Before I arrived, she had a family of 4 staying for an extend period of time. There was a little hiccup with the cleaning person getting around to the apartment before my stay. Nevertheless, Catherine apologized and rectified the situation by having them coming as soon as possible and refunding me for 2 nights. It was an understandable situation with the last guests staying so long and leaving the day I am arriving. I definitely would stay again and love the decor! The neighborhood is a great location by the Jean Talon Market and Metro station within steps.

the apartment was cute and cozy and the location was amazing. We were a short walk to the metro, to the Jean Talon market and to little Italy. If you are ok with long walks we even walked to the Mile end neighborhood one night. Buses are easy to from the apartment. Kitchen had all the utensils needed to cook some meals (which we especially since Milano market was nearby and we kept buying groceries just because everything there was so tempting!). Didn't meet Catherine but getting the keys was easy. A great place to stay!

Nous n'avons pas rencontré Catherine mais la communication a été très bonne (avant et pendant) le séjour. L'arrivée s'est déroulée très facilement. Les photos sont fidèles à la réalité quoique qu'elles ne font pas justice au logement. Très bien agencé, avec tout le nécessaire de cuisine (notamment une machine à expresso !!!! Un bonheur !!!). Couleurs vives et décorations "Frida Kahlo" :). Literie super confortable ! L'emplacement est GÉ-NI-AL  : à deux pas du marché Jean Talon, à 5 min à peine à pied de la station de métro Jean Talon, où il y a un supermarché Métro. Supermarché Provigo à 15 à pied environ. Rue calme et pas trop passagère, bien qu'à côtés de toutes les nécessités. Je recommande vivement !

Our experience in Catherine's place was really good. We spent a month there, and the apartment is just perfect for a long or short stay. The pictures don't do justice to the size of the place. We loved the neighborhood, there is a great big market right next to her place and also lot's of amazing restaurants. It's a privileged area I believe, because it's far enough from the center for things to be cheaper but you still have lots of options to eat. The location is just a little far from the tourist attractions, around 20-30 minutes by subway to each one, but her place is right next to the subway station, which is awesome!

Catherine's apartment is very vibrantly decorated, with each room a different bright colour and bold decorations. Our favourite thing about the apartment was the nice big kitchen, which was equipped with good cookware and a nice little espresso machine. There were many negative aspects about our stay. When we first arrived, there was no information about internet or other infos, so we had to search for an internet cafe to be able to get in contact with Catherine. We then had to wait quite some time before getting an answer -- an overall frustrating experience. We stayed in the flat for a month in the winter and had to go up precarious steps each day. It was our responsibility to shovel the steps and remove the ice, but no shovel was provided. Another major issue was the broken window in the bedroom. It was covered with plastic, which kept the heat in very well, but it didn't block any of the noise coming from the street, which was a problem some nights. Another thing to keep in mind is that only one set of keys was provided. This was quite inconvenient for us because we were 2 people. In general, whenever we had an issue, we were told to solve it ourselves. We managed to figure things out in the end, and the location close to the metro and nice restaurants made up for many of our frustrations.

We really enjoyed our stay. Catherine's place was warm and inviting, tidy, clean and well-maintained, and we appreciated that she had made room for us to keep our stuff. We also appreciated the well-supplied kitchen, so we could cook with the nice pots and pans, and use the espresso machine. the neighbourhood is also great. You're right next to Jean-Talon Market, which is the ideal place to get fresh groceries.
Nice place !
Agréable logement.  Facilité en tout points de vue, transport, magasin , marché, restos. Quartier agréable. A recommander sans hésitation.
The host canceled this reservation 24 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Catherine gave great directions from the airport!
The home was in great location an great heating!
It has everything you need for any length stay. 
Kitchen cupboard doors wont stay shut (bluetac must have been used in pics to keep the shut lol) an no handles on drawers an doors. My personal feeling about the bed placement ..I would like to be able to get around it. Need better tv reception. 
Overall the home needs some repairs..not quiet suitable (in my opinion) to rent out as is.
The host canceled this reservation 13 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Le séjour à Montréal dans l'appartement de Catherine à été très agréable.
Son appartement est très bien situé, à 2 pas du métro Jean Talon.

J'ai d'ailleurs beaucoup apprécié la touche de décoration avec Frida Kahlo, qui est présente dans toutes les pièces de l'appartement.

name: Gem-like UES writer's studio
summary: Gem-like, art-filled exquisitely-furnished south-facing studio, with exposed brick, high ceilings, garden views, two closets, and a hallway galley kitchen.  Steps from subway.  My personal home -- let only when I'm out of town -- with character to match.
space: This studio is my full-time home and I love it passionately. I rent it only occasionally -- when I'm out of town for work -- to responsible people I hope will love it as much as I do. It's got an ideal layout: a hallway with two (two!) closets, a bathroom with tub, a galley kitchen, and a spacious-feeling south-facing main room, with exposed brick and enough space for entertaining, sleeping, working, and more. The apartment is located in an elevator building on a quiet, historic tree-lined street.

neighborhood_overview: The Upper East Side has it all. There's the UES of Edith Wharton and Gossip Girl -- the grand museums of Museum Mile, elegant shops, Park Avenue promenades. But Yorkville, where I live, has both easy access to this UES (the m86 is 30 seconds from the apartment), has a bohemian character all its own. Tons of independent bookstores, coffee shops with local poetry reading series, vintage and consignment shopping, great food. One of the few Manhattan neighborhoods to have "mom and pop" shops (you can find a local baker, fishmonger, 3 butchers, and produce shops within a 3-block radius!). One block from Carl Schurz Park and the riverside promenade.
notes: It's a lovely building -- incredibly quiet.
transit: The M86 is a half-block away -- you can look online from home to see when the bus is approaching and still make it out the door in time to get onboard. We're five minutes from the new Q-train which connects you to midtown in 15 minutes or less. The bus connects to all major train lines on the East and West sides, or it's a 5-10 minute walk to the express 4/5 and local 6 trains at 86th street.
access: The entire apartment is yours. I am happy to clear out at least one closet for you -- negotiable based on the length of your stay.
interaction: I'll be out of town, but my friend/neighbor will be just around the corner if you need anything! Key pick up and drop off will be through a 24/7 Keycafé service just around the corner.
house_rules: Absolutely no pets, smoking, 420, etc. This is my home and I'd like to keep it as pristine as I leave it. Couples welcome.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: A journalist based between NYC, Oxford, and the Caucasus.

reviews.comments: I have stayed at many airbnbs, but this was, by far, the best. Not only was Tara incredibly helpful and responsive, her place was even better than depicted. She was out of the country but didn't let that get in the way of still being totally there to provide information and assistance. I would recommend her place on the UES to anyone visiting New York. Five stars out of five!

I very much enjoyed my stay in Isabella's apartment. The location was great, and she was excellent at responding to emails and text messages in a timely manner. I had no worries about check in or out. The flat had everything that I needed, including an elevator (I had a ton of luggage). I'd certainly stay here again.

Tara was a lovely host, her apartment was cosy, neat and 'homey'.
Before we arrived she send us an email with suggestions to good cafes, bars and restaurants in the neighborhood and "quick introduction" to the area. The neighborhood was quiet and safe, close to the water and to central park, with the subway it was easy to go to the city center.
Tara was a very attentive hostess and even that she was in a totally different time zone or traveling, she answered emails and texts quickly and precise. 
I would love to stay here again when/if returning to NYC.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this cozy, central and nice apartment for two weeks while visiting NYC for the first time. 
The combination of feeling at home, which Tara makes sure you do, while being in a new big city, was perfect for us. Tara is truely a great host, who responded to our requests quickly and helped us out with any questions we had. 
The apartment was suitable for two persons and with a small kitchen, it was possible to make some meals at home, making the vacation less expensive. The appartment is a nice walk away from Central Park and not long from a subway station to take you anywhere you want to go. There is several grocery shops nearby too. We have already started planning our next trip to NYC and we will definitely hope that Tara's apartment is available.

Tara is a great host, always helpful and did everything to make our stay pleasant.
Her apartment is small but cozy, and the mini kitchen was very handy. I think my only observation would be that the apartment walls are pretty thin, and the next door neighbors were a bit chatty at night. 
The location is great, a few blocks from the subway and close to many grocery stores and shops, we loved it!
Would definitely stay there again and recommend it, the host and the place are lovely

Great apartment in a decent location,  everything u need is around from bars to grocery,  laundry,  pharmacy etc. Subway and Bus are only minutes away in walking distance. The area it is in is also nice,  especially the Carl Schulz Park which is only 5 minutes away. Host is very responsive and friendly, would always recommend this apartment.

Very nice and comfortable apartment. The host, Tara, gave very clear instructions about the directions around the house. She was very friendly and helpful. She also helped me with advice on eating places etc. She was always available on messages if I ever needed any help. 
The location of the apartment was very nice - lots of eating places nearby, a lovely jogging track by the river 2 blocks away. 

Apartment also had an elevator which helped me avoid lug my suitcase up the stairs. 

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay there.

Isabella was a great host and her place was great too. She was very accommodating of our arrival schedule and super responsive for our questions. She was also very thoughtful in giving us info we needed for the apartment. Her place is lovely and a great size for a single or couple.

Tara is the best hostess! Very friendly, flexible, easy to reach and get quick response from. She provided very detailed useful practical information! This contributed to make many everyday things work easy for a NYC-rookie as me - and make me feel completely safe and secure during my stay.

The apartment is homey, comfortable and unique. I love the art and brick wall. It had what I needed during my stay - nice light/bright bathroom, kitchen facility, nice big bed, closet/drawer space for my clothing, couch, AC to beat the heat, wifi and (bonus!) loudspeakers to play music.

Yorkville is a very charming neighborhood. East 87th Street is pleasantly quiet, however, near busy streets where you can find good restaurants and grocery stores. I loved charming Carl Schurz Park located by the East River, just two blocks away (Tara's recommendation!). 
I have enjoyed my stay in Tara's home very much! When I come back to New York City (I definitely will) I hope I can rent it again :)

Tara went abroad when I visit her house. But, she told me key-take-point(24-hours diner) near her house by e-mail before I depart to NY. So, I could find keys easily.
I can easily arrive her house from JFK by Uber only $35. I take about 30-minutes.

My sister and I had a great time in NY with a perfect located appartment thanks to Isabella. The place is not extremly spacious but it is convinient and is really nicely decorated. the neighbourhood is quiet and nice, there's some grocery's stores around some pasteries shops, restaurants... everything needed. The subway is close by, and so is central park ! We walked to guggenheim, to the MET and sometimes we went through central park to the city center. I highly recommend Isabella's place to visit NY for few days !
We had a great stay! Thank you!

Ich war mit meiner Tochter für ein ganzes Monat in der Wohnung von Isabella und sie hat vollkommen unseren Vorstellungen entsprochen. Von Anfang an haben wir uns wohl gefühlt.
Bereits vor unserer Ankunft haben wir alle Informationen hinsichtlich Schlüsselabholung, Reinigung der Wäsche, Umgang in der Wohnung, etc.. elektronisch übermittelt bekommen und Isabella hat rasch und umfangreich alle unsere Fragen im Vorfeld abgeklärt. 
Die Wohnung ist zwar klein (1 Schlaf-/Wohnzimmer), aber sehr ruhig gelegen, da sie sich nicht in einer Durchzugsstraße befindet und außerdem in den Innenhof gerichtet ist, wo eine Aussicht auf Bäume besteht.
In der umliegenden Gegend befinden sich viele kostengünstige Lokale für alle Geschmacksrichtungen, auch Supermärkte und Drogerien sind in unmittelbarer Reichweite, was in NY sehr angenehm ist. Die nächste U-Bahn Station ist etwa 10 Gehminuten entfernt.
Durch die Lage in Yorkville sind auch viele Museen leicht zu erreichen und auch der Central Park ist nur etwa 15 min zu Fuß entfernt.

I chose Isabella's place due to the close proximity to the hospital where my mom had knee surgery done.  Her place is exactly as described and shown in the pictures.  She gave me a complete run down on her place and the neighborhood before I arrived via email.  This being my first Airbnb experience I didn't know quite what to expect, but Isabella was always prompt in responding to my various questions and requests.  Her place is accessible to public transportation and and the neighborhood is very safe.  My mom and I stayed there for an extended amount of time and felt like true locals.  I did encounter a problem returning the keys though.  The Keycafe service used for key exchange didn't recognize the fob on the keys and I was stuck there trying to figure it out while I had my mom waiting in a cab with the meter running to go to the airport.  I called the Keycafe customer service number and after 30 minutes was able to get one of the drawers unlocked so I can deposit the keys.  It was stressful start to my journey back home.

Isabella is a great host. She was waiting for us when we got the place. And she's very responsive when I texted her whenever I have questions about the place. I highly recommended Isabella and her lovely apartment.
Cozy and charming. Very convenient with the new Second Ave subway line just two blocks away.
Outstanding. 3 minute walk to new Q Line subway. Elevator in building. A+ communication with host.

We had a great week at Isabella's place. It's a small apartment but does not feel cramped at all. It feels bigger than it looks. We've stayed many times in new York and we were surprised how quiet it was, and heard very little of the noise a big city makes.

The apartment got everything you need. And with the new Q train you can quickly get to midtown and the sights. Central park is close and we walked there several times. Everything you need is also just around the corner being a convenience store, restaurant, bars..

We never got to meet our lovely host but she kept in contact and made sure we had everything we needed. Key pickup and drop-off worked like a charm. Next time I am in New York I am definitely checking first if this apt is available. Great stay!

Great stay here!  The apartment is lovely, quiet, clean and in a great location.  The host is incredibly responsive, even if she is not in the city to meet personally.  Check-in/out process was very easy.

So quiet place! I was surprised that there are no sirens in the nights. 
And you can reach subway station or bus stops under 5 minutes walking. That’s good for city travelers!

Very friendly and good host, help us when we ask about heater.
Apts is ok, central location, easy check in/check out. Slow wifi for us.
I would like a little cleaner.
The host canceled this reservation 37 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Such an amazing stay! Great location and nice on the inside. Tara was a great host and got back to me quickly and efficiently. I highly recommend staying here to anybody looking for a small, clean, cozy, quiet, place to stay when traveling/visiting! I would for sure stay again.

The apartment was exactly as described. Tara was a great host, she answered within minutes and really wanted us to have a perfect stay- which we had.
She also sent us tips for shopping and food which was Herz helpful. 
The location is perfect! 5 minutes away from the subway.

The appartment is very cosy, location is perfect and Tara ia very nice! The place can use some fresh white paint (stains on the wall) some profound cleaning and new sheets. Tara, pls get a new housekeeper and everything will be perfect!! Besides the cleaning it was a great place!!

The apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood, close to the subway and to a beautiful park near the river. The 5 floor building is quiet and it has a lift. The apartment has air conditioner (something very important in summer) and it is decorated with elegant details, just like the pictures.
Only I want to warn that is an inhabited apartment so all the host belongings are everywhere. Someone might find this situation a little awkaward. The cleanness in general was ok, but some places needed more attention.
The host was very kind and considerate to me, her responses were every time helpful, accurate and quick.

The apartment is just as shown and described on the site which is positive. It’s a small place suitable for couples but don’t expect to get too much cooking done as the kitchen is tiny. Perfect place for sleeping, showering and off to sightseeing as it is well connected with the metro and is located in a safe and quiet area.
It's cute. It's eclectic. It's artsy, scholarly. The location is fantastic. Loved Yorkville! It's a bargain for this area.
